title: Research: Jetson Thor sm_110 CUDA 13.0 compatibility
description:
Deep research on NVIDIA Jetson AGX Thor CUDA 13.0 compatibility:

Questions to answer:
1. What are sm_110 specific requirements?
2. CUDA 13.0 kernel syntax changes from CUDA 12.x?
3. TensorRT compatibility on Thor?
4. Memory management for Thor's unified memory?

Sources:
- NVIDIA NGC containers for Thor
- CUDA 13.0 programming guide
- JetPack 7.4 documentation
- arXiv papers on Jetson development
close_reason: Research completed: Thor sm_110 requires CUDA 13.0 with -arch=sm_110, -std=c++17, -device-entity-has-hidden-visibility=false. Findings stored in Cipher.

title: Research: So-VITS-SVC 5.0 architecture and alternatives
description:
Research latest singing voice conversion architectures:

Questions to answer:
1. Latest So-VITS-SVC 5.0 model architecture?
2. HuBERT-Soft vs newer alternatives (w2v-BERT, WavLM)?
3. RMVPE vs other pitch extractors (FCPE, CREPE)?
4. Optimal vocoder for singing voice (HiFi-GAN, BigVGAN)?

Sources:
- GitHub: svc-develop-team/so-vits-svc
- arXiv papers on singing voice conversion
- Recent SVC papers (2024-2025)
notes: Research completed. Key findings: ContentVec > HuBERT-Soft, FCPE 5.3x faster than RMVPE, BigVGAN recommended over HiFi-GAN. Stored in Cipher memory.
close_reason: Research completed: ContentVec superior to HuBERT-Soft, FCPE 5.3x faster than RMVPE, BigVGAN recommended over HiFi-GAN. Findings stored in Cipher.

title: Research: aarch64 dependency building for CUDA 13
description:
Research dependency availability and building for aarch64 + CUDA 13:

Questions to answer:
1. Which dependencies need source compilation?
2. Pre-built wheels available for Thor?
3. Conda-forge packages for aarch64 + CUDA 13?

Sources:
- PyPI aarch64 wheel availability
- NVIDIA JetPack package repositories
- conda-forge ARM64 builds
notes: Research completed. Key findings: SBSA architecture on Thor, use sbsa/cu130 repo, libcudss.so.0 missing is known issue, NumPy ABI mismatch needs 1.x, NGC containers recommended.
close_reason: Research completed: SBSA architecture on Thor, use sbsa/cu130 repo, libcudss.so.0 known issue, NumPy ABI mismatch needs 1.x. Findings stored in Cipher.

title: Fix incomplete web/app.py - missing create_app
description:
The src/auto_voice/web/app.py is incomplete (only 6 lines of imports).
The complete create_app function exists in src/web/app.py (304 lines).
Need to copy and fix imports to restore Flask app functionality.
close_reason: Fixed: Restored complete create_app function with config parameter support

title: Fix CUDA kernel compilation for sm_110 (Thor)
description:
CUDA kernel compilation fails due to C++ namespace compatibility between CUDA 13.0 headers and PyTorch nightly.

Error: namespace c10::impl nested namespace syntax not recognized by nvcc.

Current workaround: Using PyTorch fallbacks (GPU still used, just not custom kernels).

Fix options:
1. Add -std=c++17 flag to nvcc compilation
2. Modify kernel source to use compatible namespace syntax
3. Wait for PyTorch nightly update with fixed headers
notes: Starting CUDA kernel fixes based on research. Will update setup.py with sm_110 arch and fix kernel syntax for CUDA 13.0 compatibility.

title: Test Suite Summary: 505 passed, 316 failed (61%)
description:
Test suite run completed on autovoice-thor environment.

Results:
- 505 passed
- 316 failed
- 284 skipped
- 39 errors

Main failure categories:
1. Web interface tests - missing job_manager endpoints (404 errors)
2. Voice conversion tests - model initialization errors
3. Inference pipeline tests - device assertion mismatches (cuda:0 vs cuda)
4. CUDA kernel tests - using PyTorch fallbacks due to compilation issues

Core functionality working:
- Flask app creation and routing
- Audio processing (mel spectrogram, feature extraction)
- Frontend build successful
- PyTorch CUDA operations working

Setup scripts created:
- scripts/setup_jetson_thor.sh
- requirements-jetson.txt
notes: Updated 2026-01-13: Test suite improved to 583 passed (65%) after fixture and blueprint fixes.
